description: Irish Soda Bread is a quick bread that does not require any yeast. Instead, all of its leavening comes from baking soda and buttermilk. This Irish Soda Bread recipe is my grandmother’s and has been cherished in my family for years. It’s dense, yet soft and has the most incredible crusty exterior.
ingredients: [{"name": "buttermilk", "units": "cups", "amount": "1 and 3/4"}, {"name": "egg", "units": "large", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "cups", "amount": "4 and 1/4"}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": "3"}, {"name": "baking soda", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1"}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "Tablespoons", "amount": "5"}, {"name": "raisins", "units": "cup", "amount": "1"}]
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C). Whisk buttermilk and egg together. Whisk flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl. Cut in the butter until pea-sized crumbs. Stir in raisins. Pour in buttermilk/egg mixture and fold until too stiff to stir. Transfer to prepared skillet/pan, score the dough, and bake until golden brown, about 45-55 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.
notes: Buttermilk is key to the bread’s flavor, texture, and rise. The bread will not rise without it. You can make a homemade buttermilk substitute if needed.
tags: bread, quick bread, Irish, soda bread
